newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Mayoral candidate killed by guerrillas in Colombia.
newsitem.headline: Mayoral candidate killed by guerrillas in Colombia.

text.p: Ricardo Jimenez, a mayoral candidate for the Conservative party in the Municipality of San Carlos, was shot and killed by rebels on Friday, police reported.
The attack, by guerrillas of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) took place at a roadblock in Antioquia province near San Carlos.
Also, in the municipality of Remedios, a rebel unit of the National Liberation Army burned down the Electoral building, police said.
Colombia will hold general elections in October to choose mayors, governors, local authorities and deputies.
Guerrilla groups have vowed to stop candidates of the Liberal and Conservative parties to prevent elections in their areas of influence.
Elsewhere, the Colombian Army reported that four soldiers were killed in combat with FARC guerrillas in a remote area of the municipality of Mutata, 248 miles (400 km) northwest of Bogota.
